# Format 
f"" -> this is used for the formating the print function and it is very useful and easy.
```{python}
Name=Name.title().strip()
print(f"hello, {Name}")
```

# Pythonic 1
```{python}
#name= input("what's your name? ").strip().title()
name = "swarup sarker"
print(f"hello, {name}")

#split the first name and the last name
first,last= name.split(" ")
print(f"hello, {first}")
```

# Float and integer

```{python}
#round(number, ndigits)
#x = float(input("what's is x? "))
x=12.455 
#y = float(input("what's is y? "))
y=34.234
z = round(x/y, 3)
print(z)
```

Others way of formating
```{python}
z = x/y
print(f"{z:.2f}")
```
